item.title: Report E-2024050277
item.description:
Report E-2024050277

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: MERIDEN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHR experienced a UN2014 Oxteril 34 LRA release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.25 cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the tote lid due to a broken cap caused by improper loading. The cap was replaced with a new one. The damaged cap and impacted rags used to wipe down the tote were containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING WHILE ON AN IRREG CART. TRAIN DRIVER DROVE THE TRAIN WITH CART TO THE DMP AREA. RESPONDER REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE TRAIN AND PUT IT IN A LINED SPILL TUB FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024050243
item.description:
Report E-2024050243

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-14T15:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/04/2024 Veolia employees were unloading a cubic yard box into a trailer at the 10-Day transfer area in Veolia, South Windsor, CT facility when an employee noticed a few drops of liquid coming out of a cubic yard box. Only a couple of drops were observed under the cubic yard box. The employees noticed the leak right away and quickly put down some spill pads to contain the leak. Employees proceeded to open the container and observed many inner paint related material containers were dented or leaking inside the cubic yard box. Employees righted the inner containers, poured absorbent into the cubic yard box to prevent any further leaks, and transported the container to the ultimate disposal facility.
